January 10, 1956
Mr, Stan Russell
Radio Program Director
Department of Public Health
Lemuel Shattuck Hospital
170 Morton Street
Jamaica Plain 30, Massachusetts
Dear Mr, Russellj
In reply to your request of January 7, I am enclosing some brochures which
will give you information about the purposes and functions of the NAEB.
From your letter, I presume that your hospital operates a closed-circuit
radio station, rather than a regular broadcasting station. Such closed-
circuit stations are not eligible for Active membership in the NAEB, and only
Active members are permitted to use the programs distributed by our NAEB
Network via tape recordings.
However, the hospital could become an Affiliate member of the NAEB and as
such receive many of the publications, surveys and reports we make available
to our members. Annual dues for Affiliate membership, including a sub¬
scription to our monthly Newsletter are $10.
I am also enclosing a list of materials we have available which will give
you an idea of the various reports and publications we issue, some of which
have been issued free to Affiliate members. Unfortunately, we have nothing
on closed-circuit TV which would be helpful.
If, after you’ve looked over these materials, you have any further questions
about the Association or membership in it, please let me know.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
HEHijy
Enclosures
